events.originalText: Warren Zevon made his last public appearance on the Late Show with David Letterman, giving the advice to "enjoy every sandwich".
events.subtitle: Warren Zevon
events.headline: Warren Zevon makes last public appearance on Late Show with David Letterman

events.originalText: The Troubles: Three members of the Ulster Defence Association opened fire in a crowded pub during a Halloween party, killing eight people and wounding nineteen others.
events.subtitle: The Troubles
events.headline: Ulster Defence Association members open fire in crowded pub, killing eight

events.originalText: The Madrid Conference, an attempt by the international community to revive the Israeli–Palestinian peace process through negotiations, convened.
events.subtitle: Madrid Conference of 1991
events.headline: Madrid Conference convenes to revive Israeli-Palestinian peace process

events.originalText: Singaporean leftist opposition leader Chia Thye Poh was detained under the Internal Security Act, which allows for preventive detention, and held for 32 years.
events.subtitle: Chia Thye Poh
events.headline: Singaporean opposition leader Chia Thye Poh detained under Internal Security Act

events.originalText: English model Jean Shrimpton wore a controversially short minidress to Derby Day at Flemington Racecourse in Melbourne, Australia – a pivotal moment of the introduction of the miniskirt to women's fashion.
events.subtitle: Jean Shrimpton
events.headline: Jean Shrimpton wears controversial minidress to Derby Day in Melbourne

events.originalText: At the Royal Infirmary of Edinburgh, Michael Woodruff performed the first successful kidney transplantation in the United Kingdom.
events.subtitle: Royal Infirmary of Edinburgh
events.headline: First successful kidney transplantation performed in UK

events.originalText: A luzzu fishing boat overloaded with passengers capsized and sank in the Gozo Channel off Qala, Gozo, Malta, killing 23 of the 27 people on board (monument pictured).
events.subtitle: Luzzu
events.headline: Luzzu fishing boat capsizes in Gozo Channel, killing 23

events.originalText: CBS Radio broadcast the radio drama The War of the Worlds,  causing panic among some listeners who believed that an actual Martian invasion was in progress.
events.subtitle: CBS Radio
events.headline: CBS Radio broadcasts The War of the Worlds, causing panic among listeners

events.originalText: King Lobengula of Matabeleland granted the Rudd Concession to agents of Cecil Rhodes, leading to the creation of the British South Africa Company.
events.subtitle: Lobengula
events.headline: King Lobengula grants Rudd Concession to Cecil Rhodes' agents

events.originalText: Seventeen-year-old Vilhelm, Prince of Denmark, arrived in Athens to become King George I of Greece (pictured).
events.subtitle: Athens
events.headline: Seventeen-year-old Prince of Denmark becomes King George I of Greece

events.originalText: War of the Fourth Coalition: Believing that they were outnumbered, the German garrison at Stettin surrendered to a much smaller French force without a fight.
events.subtitle: War of the Fourth Coalition
events.headline: German garrison surrenders to French force in War of the Fourth Coalition
